tool.name: IDR
tool.command: idr --samples '$primus' '$secundus' #if $peak_list: --peak-list '$peak_list' #end if #if $input_file_type: #if $primus.dataset.ext == 'gff': --input-file-type gff #else: --input-file-type $input_file_type #end if #end if #if $idr_threshold: --idr-threshold $idr_threshold #end if #if $rank != 'default': --rank $rank #end if --output-file idrValues.bed --soft-idr-threshold $soft_idr_threshold $plot $use_nonoverlapping_peaks --peak-merge-method $peak_merge_method --initial-mu $initial_mu --initial-sigma $initial_sigma --initial-rho $initial_rho --initial-mix-param $initial_mix_param $fix_mu $fix_sigma $dont_filter_peaks_below_noise_mean $use_best_multisummit_idr $allow_negative_scores --random-seed $random_seed --max-iter $max_iter --convergence-eps $convergence_eps $only_merge_peaks

param.name: primus
param.label: First set of peaks in GFF or BED format

param.name: secundus
param.label: Second set of peaks in GFF or BED format

param.name: peak_list
param.label: List of peaks to filter by

param.name: input_file_type
param.label: Input BED format
param.help: This option is ignored if the input file is GFF

param.label: Column to use for ranking peaks
Output PNG plot of peaks

param.name: use_nonoverlapping_peaks
param.label: Use peaks without an overlapping match and set the value to 0

param.name: peak_merge_method
param.label: Method to use for merging peaks

param.name: initial_mu
param.label: Initial value of mu

param.name: initial_sigma
param.label: Initial value of sigma

param.name: initial_rho
param.label: Initial value of rho

param.name: initial_mix_param
param.label: Initial value of the mixture parameters

param.name: fix_mu
param.label: Fix mu to the starting point and do not let it vary

param.name: fix_sigma
param.label: Fix sigma to the starting point and do not let it vary

param.name: dont_filter_peaks_below_noise_mean
param.label: Allow signal points that are below the noise mean

param.name: use_best_multisummit_idr
param.label: Set the IDR value for a group of multi summit peaks
param.help: A group of peaks with the same chr/start/stop but different summits

param.name: allow_negative_scores
param.label: Allow negative values for scores

param.name: random_seed
param.label: The random seed value

param.name: max_iter
param.label: The maximum number of optimization iterations

param.name: convergence_eps
param.label: The maximum change in parameter value changes for convergence

param.name: only_merge_peaks
param.label: Only return the merged peak list

tool.help: The `IDR <https://github.com/nboley/idr/blob/master/README.md>`__ (Irreproducible Discovery Rate) framework is a unified approach to measure the reproducibility of findings identified from replicate experiments and provide highly stable thresholds based on reproducibility. Unlike the usual scalar measures of reproducibility, the IDR approach creates a curve, which quantitatively assesses when the findings are no longer consistent across replicates.
